content.title: Myocardial Infarction Definition
content.summary: Acute necrosis of myocardial tissue due to ischemia
content.statement: Myocardial infarction (MI) is irreversible myocardial cell death due to prolonged ischemia, typically caused by coronary artery occlusion, diagnosed by elevated cardiac biomarkers with clinical evidence of myocardial ischemia.

explanation.intuition: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to part of the heart muscle is blocked long enough to cause cell death. Time is critical - 'time is muscle'.
explanation.key_insight: The Fourth Universal Definition requires evidence of acute myocardial injury (elevated troponin with rise/fall pattern) plus clinical evidence of acute myocardial ischemia.
explanation.technical_details: Type 1 MI results from atherothrombotic CAD. Type 2 MI results from oxygen supply-demand mismatch. Type 3 is sudden cardiac death. Types 4-5 are procedure-related.

citations.source: Thygesen K, et al. Fourth Universal Definition of Myocardial Infarction. Circulation 2018;138:e618-e651.
